definition: to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Why is it that all these girls are now moving around hustling?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼現在弄成了這些女孩在四處‘拉客’？

sentences.english: Look at this little car is not like breaking soliciting, but I do not know him.
sentences.chinese: 看這小破車不像是拉客的，但我不認識他呀。

sentences.english: A prostitute am soliciting on the road.
He is a new salesman and he literally pounds the pavement looking for customers.
sentences.chinese: 他是新上崗的推銷員，爲了拉客戶四處奔走。

definition: unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
(northern dialect) to pick up a fare (as a taxi driver)/to pick up a piece of work (as a courier)
motorcycle taxi/abbr. for 摩托車的士|摩托车的士[mo2 tuo1 che1 di1 shi4]
to refuse to take a passenger (of taxi)
person who joins with others to reduce costs (carpooling, group buying, sharing an apartment etc)
to receive guests/to receive patrons (of prostitutes)
